rollups.r1: SELECT number1, count(number1) GROUP BY number1
rollups.r2: SELECT count(ward), ward GROUP BY ward
rollups.r3: SELECT ward, count(*), count(crime_type) GROUP BY ward
rollups.r4: SELECT ward, crime_type, count(*), number1, crime_date GROUP BY ward, crime_type, number1, crime_date
rollups.r5: SELECT crime_type, count(1) group by crime_type
rollups.r7: SELECT ward, min(number1), max(number1), sum(number1), count(*) GROUP BY ward
rollups.r8: SELECT date_trunc_ym(crime_date), ward, count(*) GROUP BY date_trunc_ym(crime_date), ward
rollups.r9: SELECT crime_type, count(case(crime_date IS NOT NULL, crime_date, true, some_date)) group by crime_type
rollups.r10: SELECT ward, sum(number1), count(number1) GROUP BY ward

tests.query: SELECT ward, count(*) AS ward_count GROUP BY ward

rewrites.r4: SELECT c1 AS ward, coalesce(sum(c3), 0) AS ward_count GROUP by c1
rewrites.r8: SELECT c2 AS ward, coalesce(sum(c3), 0) AS ward_count GROUP by c2
rewrites.r3: SELECT c1 AS ward, coalesce(sum(c3), 0) AS ward_count
rewrites.r7: SELECT c1 AS ward, coalesce(sum(c3), 0) AS ward_count
